snippet: The decision to close Corporate Commercial Bank, the country’s fourth-largest lender, came after an audit showed that records relating to most of the bank’s loan portfolio were missing.
abstract: Bulgaria's central bank will start bankruptcy proceedings against the Corporate Commercial Bank, marking first such collapse in Eastern Europe since the 1990s; decision follows discovery that records relating to most of bank's loan portfolio were missing, and that $136 million in cash was withdrawn from vaults as thousands of fearful depositors lined up to pull out savings.
lead_paragraph: The decision to close Corporate Commercial Bank, the country’s fourth-largest lender, came after an audit showed that records relating to most of the bank’s loan portfolio were missing.

headline.main: In a First Since the 1990s, a Large Bulgarian Bank Goes Bankrupt
headline.print_headline: In a First Since the 1990s, a Large Bulgarian Bank Goes Bankrupt
